Manufacturing Intelligence


Automate Your Process

An automated process simplifies production of high quality products, freeing your team to focus on cost, energy, and production efficiency.

Interact With Your System

A well-designed user interface allows your team to monitor and maintain your process while quickly responding to process upsets.

Understand Your Process

Turning your process data into information enables you to understand & reduce your production costs throughout the supply chain.

Connect Your Enterprise

In a connected company everyone works as one team to optimize business processes all of the way from the shop floor to the top floor.

Automation

The goal of automation is to repeatedly execute a production process, enabling you to make consistent products every time one rolls off the line. Automation simplifies production by using Programmable Logic Controllers (PLCs) to handle tedious tasks, freeing your team to understand manage your resource usage and costs more effectively. Automation is the first step towards making your business work for you.

Interaction

Once your process is automated your operators need a way to leverage their expertise and experience with your systems. This is where a Human Machine Interface (HMI) comes into play. This system gives your operators full control of your process with feedback on status, alarms, upsets, etc. At this level some of your data can even be turned into information through the use of historical trends, dashboard elements, and other operator notifications.

Manufacturing Intelligence

In a similar way to your HMI system adding a layer of intelligence to your automated systems, a Manufacturing Execution System (MES) enables you to make even smarter decisions. MES systems turn your data into useful information enabling you to directly correlate things like energy usage, inventory, and quality to real-time process conditions. Using this information allows you to fully understand your process and how it can be optimized to reach its highest potential.

Connected Enterprise

After you have automated and optimized your processes at the plant level the next impact to your bottom line comes from becoming a connected enterprise. By connecting the shop floor to the top floor and everything in between you will have information on how all areas of your organization are interconnected. Each level of your organization will have access to the information they need in the way they need to see it to make better decisions.
